timeline.bodyText: I don't understand the purpose of this time series. Is it a double or a string time series. Could you give an example of what is going to contain?
timeline.author: geofjamg

replies.bodyText:
It will be a string time series containing a textual description of events that have been considered relevant during the dynamic simulation. An example from Dynawo output (time is given in milliseconds since the start of the simulation):
5000	 _BUS____1-BUS____5-1_AC  LINE : opening on side 2
5000	 GEN____3_SM  PMIN : deactivation
5248	 CLA_2_5  CLA : arming by over-current constraint
5405	 GEN____6_SM  PMIN : activation
10248	 CLA_2_5  CLA : order to change topology
10248	 _BUS____2-BUS____5-1_AC  LINE : opening both sides
replies.author: zamarrenolm

replies.bodyText: Ok thanks it is clear now, so maybe we can use StringTimeSeries in the API?
replies.author: geofjamg

timeline.message: Merge branch 'master' into dynamic-simulation-output

use StringTimeSeries with TimeLine info

Signed-off-by: Marcos de Miguel <demiguelm@aia.es>

timeline.bodyText: Could you assert that both curves and timeline are not null? I saw in the unit test that the timeline could be null. Is it possible to create an empty timeline without any entries?
timeline.author: mathbagu

timeline.bodyText:
I don't understand this change: I would expect to serialize the curves and the timeline instead. Maybe it's better than a zip file.
@zamarrenolm @marcosmc what do you think?
timeline.author: mathbagu
